eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Paint transition effects with a plain color.
description: A blur effect can be added to the painter layer to smooth the transition.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Ensure shape painter properties are set correctly for this extension to work.
from left to right
from top to bottom
A circle scale up from the middle.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Paint effect type _PARAM4_ of _PARAM0_ with direction _PARAM5_ and color _PARAM2_ for _PARAM3_ seconds

events.comment:
Initialise all variables and then activate the behavior.
If user doesn't assign value to color and type , we take the last value registred.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward an object.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward _PARAM5_ with speed _PARAM6_ px/s

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward a position.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets in the direction of a given angle.
eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: When firing in a full circle, prevent first and last bullet from using the same angle

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a single bullet. This is only meant to be used inside the "Fire bullet" action.
eventsFunctions.name: FireSingleBullet
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire a single bullet _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: Create bullet
Move bullet (apply angle and bullet speed variances)
Rotate newly created bullet, if needed
Update statistics

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.name: ReloadAmmo

eventsFunctions.name: HasJustFired

eventsFunctions.description: Check if bullet rotates to match trajectory.
eventsFunctions.name: BulletRotationEnabled

eventsFunctions.description: the firing arc (in degrees) where bullets are shot. Bullets are evenly spaced out inside the firing arc.
eventsFunctions.name: FiringArc

eventsFunctions.description: Change the firing arc (in degrees) where bullets will be shot. Bullets will be evenly spaced out inside the firing arc.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFiringArc
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set firing arc of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ degrees

eventsFunctions.description: Change the speed variance (pixels per second) applied to each bullet.

eventsFunctions.description: the number of bullets shot every time the "fire bullet" action is used.

eventsFunctions.sentence: the number of bullets per shot

eventsFunctions.sentence: Set number of bullets per shot of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Enable bullet rotation.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRotateBullet

eventsFunctions.description: Enable unlimited ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: SetUnlimitedAmmo

eventsFunctions.description: the firing cooldown (in seconds) also known as rate of fire.
eventsFunctions.name: Cooldown

eventsFunctions.description: Change the firing cooldown, which changes the rate of fire.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCooldown
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the fire rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the reload duration (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.description: Change the duration to reload ammo.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the reload duration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.name: OverheatDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Change the duration after becoming overheated.
eventsFunctions.name: SetOverheatDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the overheat duration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the ammo quantity.
eventsFunctions.name: AmmoQuantity

eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the ammo quantity of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.name: SetHeatPerShot

eventsFunctions.name: MaxAmmo

eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxAmmo

eventsFunctions.name: ExponentialCoolingRate

eventsFunctions.description: Change the exponential rate of cooling.
eventsFunctions.name: SetExponentialCoolingRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the exponential cooling rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Increase ammo quantity.
eventsFunctions.name: IncreaseAmmo

events.comment: If Max Ammo is set, do not exceed the value

eventsFunctions.description: Layer that bullets are created on.
eventsFunctions.name: BulletLayer

eventsFunctions.description: the heat level (range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: HeatLevel

eventsFunctions.name: OverheatTimeLeft
eventsFunctions.sentence: the remaining duration before the overheat end

eventsFunctions.description: the remaining duration before the reload finishes, in seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: ReloadTimeLeft
eventsFunctions.sentence: the remaining duration before the reload finishes

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PointAndOrbit
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Point and orbit an object toward a position or angle.
description: Move an object in a circle around a specific point while pointing the moving object away from the center of the circle.
This feature is useful in games for weapons or targeting indicators that move around a player character.
Orbit distance and rotation speed can be changed easily.
The target position action can be used to follow the direction of the cursor.
The target angle action can be used to follow hte direction of a gamepad stick

eventsFunctions.description: Point and Orbit an object toward a position.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Point and Orbit toward a position
eventsFunctions.name: PointAndOrbit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Point _PARAM1_ at _PARAM5_ Xpos, _PARAM6_ Ypos, at _PARAM7_ pointing speed, and orbit around _PARAM2_ Xpos, _PARAM3_ Ypos, at _PARAM4_ distance

parameters.longDescription: The object that is going to orbit and rotate.
parameters.name: Gun

parameters.longDescription: Gun object will orbit around this X position.
parameters.name: OrbitXpos

parameters.longDescription: Gun object will orbit around this Y position.
parameters.name: OrbitYpos

parameters.longDescription:
Distance between the Gun object and the Orbit positions X and Y.  
Example: 50 .
parameters.name: OrbitDistance

parameters.longDescription: Point the gun object to this Xposition.
parameters.name: PointXpos

parameters.longDescription: Point the gun object to this Yposition.
parameters.name: PointYpos

parameters.longDescription: Set to 0 for an immediate pointing.
parameters.name: PointSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Point and Orbit an object toward an angle.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Point and Orbit toward an angle
eventsFunctions.name: PointAndOrbitAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Point _PARAM1_ towards _PARAM5_ degrees at _PARAM6_ pointing speed, and orbit around _PARAM2_ Xpos, _PARAM3_ Ypos, at _PARAM4_ distance

events.name: Determine the orbit angle for the next frame (using the shortest path)

parameters.longDescription: The object that is going to orbit and rotate.
parameters.name: Gun

parameters.longDescription: Gun object will orbit around this X position.
parameters.name: OrbitXpos

parameters.longDescription: Gun object will orbit around this Y position.
parameters.name: OrbitYpos

parameters.longDescription:
Distance between the Gun object and the Orbit positions X and Y.  
Example: 50 .
parameters.name: OrbitDistance

parameters.longDescription: Point the gun object to this angle
parameters.name: TargetAngle

parameters.longDescription: Set to 0 for an immediate pointing.
parameters.name: PointSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

events.comment: Health
Correct any values above maximum limits
Shield
Correct any values above maximum limits

events.name: Remove shield points if shield expired

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.description: current health points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Change the health points of the object. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the health of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

events.comment: If MaxHealth is set, prevent health from going above it

eventsFunctions.description: Change the health points of the object. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCurrentHealth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the health of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object by increasing its health points.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

events.comment: If Max Health is not set, do not enforce Max Health
If Max Health is set and Overhealing is not allowed
Perform heal
Update healing trigger

parameters.description: Points to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum health points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxHealth

events.comment: Make sure Current Health does not exceed new Max Health

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object maximum health points.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxHealth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum health of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: the rate of health regeneration (points per second).
eventsFunctions.name: HealthRegenRate

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Delay the camera according to a maximum speed and catch up the delay.
eventsFunctions.name: WaitAndCatchUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delay the camera of _PARAM0_ during: _PARAM2_ seconds according to the maximum speed _PARAM3_;_PARAM4_ seconds and catch up in _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Maybe the catch-up show be done in constant pixel speed instead of constant time speed.

eventsFunctions.description: Update delayed position and delayed history. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateDelayedPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update delayed position and delayed history of _PARAM0_

events.comment: Add the previous position to have enough (2) positions to evaluate the extra delay for waiting mode.
Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.name: AddForecastHistoryPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add the time:_PARAM2_ and position: _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ to the forecast history of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful.
Keep at least 2 positions because no forecast can be done with less positions.

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX))
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY))
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ForecastTimeRatio

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
- Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctions.description: Blend two RGB colors by applying a weighted mean.
eventsFunctions.name: RgbMean

inlineCode: // split do allocations, but the code a lot simpler this way.
const r = gdjs.evtTools.common.clamp(Math.round((1 - ratio) * r1 + ratio * r2), 0, 255);
const g = gdjs.evtTools.common.clamp(Math.round((1 - ratio) * g1 + ratio * g2), 0, 255);
const b = gdjs.evtTools.common.clamp(Math.round((1 - ratio) * b1 + ratio * b2), 0, 255);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

parameters.longDescription: Range: 0 to 1, where 0 gives the first color and 1 gives the second color
parameters.name: Ratio
